description: An artificial resort island-ship owned by Doran that provides vacation services to paying customers. Features spa facilities and can sail the seas as a mobile resort.
geography: A large ship constructed as a floating resort island with spa facilities, pools, and entertainment areas. Contains hidden chambers and a giant cannon.
culture: A commercial vacation destination where anyone can stay if they can pay, including pirates.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Begin Destroying Spa Island
keyEvents.description: Luffy decides to wreck Spa Island to find Sayo, and the crew begins flooding and destroying parts of the island-ship.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of the conflict's escalation.

keyEvents.title: Spa Island Destroyed
keyEvents.description: Luffy's Gigant Axe attack splits Spa Island in two, destroying the resort and revealing the X-shaped underwater volcano beneath it.
keyEvents.significance: Concludes the arc with the island's complete destruction.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of X-Shaped Underwater Volcano
keyEvents.description: After Spa Island is destroyed, the X-shaped underwater volcano is revealed beneath the island, providing the final ingredient for the rainbow gem.
keyEvents.significance: Solves the mystery of the father's map and research.

statusHistory.description: Split in half and destroyed by Luffy

trivia: Spa Island was built above an X-shaped underwater volcano, which was the key to the rainbow gem creation.
The island could function as both a resort and a mobile ship sailing the seas.
Doran used the island as a front for his schemes to obtain the rainbow gem secret.

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' ship, constructed by Franky and the Galley-La Company.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Loses the Rainbow Gem on the Sunny
keyEvents.description: As candy rain falls on the Thousand Sunny, Luffy accidentally loses the rainbow gem that Sayo and Lina sent to the crew.
keyEvents.significance: Provides a comedic ending to the arc.

governance: Owned by the Straw Hat Pirates
